description: From Medieval Latin prognosticare; see prognostic for more.

verbs.description: prognosticate (third-person singular simple present prognosticates, present participle prognosticating, simple past and past participle prognosticated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To predict or forecast, especially through the application of skill.
examples: Examining the tea-leaves, she prognosticated dark days ahead.
The bluebells may prognosticate an early spring this year.
